article.title: Dark energy survivals in massive gravity after GW170817: SO(3) invariant

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements about Figure 1 is correct?
choices: All models shown in Figure 1 exhibit a phantom equation of state (wDE < -1) at late times.
Model (a) represents the ΛCDM model, with a constant dark energy equation of state wDE = -1.
Models (b) and (c) have a dark energy equation of state that starts below -1 and then increases to -1.
In all models, the dark energy equation of state wDE is always larger than -1.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 shows the evolution of c²<sub>V</sub>, c²<sub>S</sub>, and w<sub>DE</sub> for two specific models. Which of the following statements accurately describes the behavior of these quantities?
choices: In both models, the quantities c²<sub>V</sub> and c²<sub>S</sub> decrease with increasing redshift (z+1).
In the left panel, both c²<sub>V</sub> and c²<sub>S</sub> approach a final value of 0, indicating the presence of ghosts and Laplacian instabilities at late times.
In the right panel, the phantom equation of state (w<sub>DE</sub> < -1) is realized with both c²<sub>V</sub> and c²<sub>S</sub> remaining positive throughout the evolution.
In the left panel, the dark energy equation of state w<sub>DE</sub> starts from a value larger than -1 and finally approaches -1 with the dominance of Ω<sub>DE0</sub>.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (3.18) describes the dark energy equation of state (w<sub>DE</sub>) in the studied model. Which of the following conditions leads to a dark energy equation of state different from -1?

Equation (7.19) shows the effective gravitational coupling (G<sub>eff</sub>) in the presence of massive gravity. Under which condition does G<sub>eff</sub> reduce to the Newtonian gravitational constant G?
choices: When all the mass terms m<sub>i</sub> are much smaller than the Hubble expansion rate H.
In the limit where the wavenumber k approaches 0.
When the dark energy equation of state is equal to -1 (w<sub>DE</sub> = -1).
In the limit where the wavenumber k approaches infinity.
